resources.name: Centinela Youth Services (CYS)
resources.description: Community-based nonprofit providing diversion and restorative justice services to youth across Los Angeles County for over 40 years. Offers trauma-informed, community-based programs to prevent and divert youth from the juvenile justice system.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Youth involved or at risk of involvement in the juvenile justice system throughout Los Angeles County.
resources.fees: Free - all direct services for youth, families, and community members are free
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Centinela Youth Services Los Angeles reentry'

resources.name: Community Build
resources.description: Provides youth services for at-risk adolescents and young adults in the Crenshaw area of South Los Angeles, offering programs focused on development and community engagement.
resources.eligibility_requirements: At-risk adolescents and young adults in the Crenshaw area of Los Angeles.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Community Build Los Angeles South LA youth'

resources.name: Para Los Niños
resources.description: Comprehensive education and youth services organization providing early education (preschool/Head Start), charter schools (TK-8th grade), and support services throughout Los Angeles to help children and families succeed.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Children and families in Los Angeles. Early education programs have income eligibility requirements. Charter schools serve TK-8th grade students.
resources.fees: Head Start is free for eligible families, charter schools are free public schools
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Para Los Niños Los Angeles education'

resources.name: Alma Family Services
resources.description: Dedicated to advancing the quality of life of families and individuals coping with emotional difficulties, substance abuse, and developmental challenges. Provides comprehensive mental health and substance abuse services at multiple locations in East LA.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Families and individuals coping with emotional difficulties, substance abuse, and/or developmental challenges. Serves LA County residents.
resources.fees: Accepts Medi-Cal and other insurance, sliding scale available
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Alma Family Services Los Angeles mental health'

resources.name: Walden Family Services - Los Angeles
resources.description: Provides foster care, adoption, and Transitional Age Youth (TAY) programs to assist young adults aged 16-24 as they transition from foster care to independent living. Offers stable housing and support for education, life skills, and employment.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Children and youth in foster care system. TAY program serves ages 16-24, with extended foster care option for ages 18-21. Serves Los Angeles County and surrounding areas.
resources.fees: Services provided through foster care system funding
accessibility_features: Multiple locations including Encino and Palmdale
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Walden Family Services Los Angeles foster care reentry youth'

resources.name: Step Up on Second
resources.description: Provides permanent housing and mental health services to individuals facing homelessness with serious mental illness. Operates supportive housing facilities and offers comprehensive case management for housing stability.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Individuals facing homelessness with serious mental illness. Referral-based - must be referred by local government or partner agency. Daniel's Place specifically serves young adults ages 18-28.
resources.fees: Free services for eligible referred participants
accessibility_features: Drop-in hours available at some locations
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Step Forward Los Angeles homeless prevention' (identified as Step Up)

resources.name: Asian Pacific Counseling and Treatment Centers (APCTC)
resources.description: Provides culturally-sensitive mental health and substance abuse services to Asian Pacific Islander communities and others throughout Los Angeles County. Offers services in multiple Asian languages at six locations.
resources.address: 520 S La Fayette Park Place, Suite 300
resources.eligibility_requirements: Open to all, with specialized culturally-sensitive services for Asian Pacific Islander communities. Serves Los Angeles County residents.
resources.fees: Accepts Medi-Cal and other insurance, sliding scale available
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Asian Pacific Counseling and Treatment Centers Los Angeles'

resources.name: El Proyecto del Barrio
resources.description: Provides health and human services to underserved Latino/a communities throughout San Fernando Valley, San Gabriel Valley, and East Los Angeles since 1971. Offers bilingual behavioral health, substance abuse treatment, and comprehensive support services.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Men and women with substance abuse and mental health needs. Specialized services for women who are pregnant, postpartum, or parenting. Serves underserved communities in San Fernando Valley, San Gabriel Valley, and East LA.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'El Proyecto del Barrio Los Angeles substance abuse Latino'

resources.name: Homeless Health Care Los Angeles (HHCLA)
resources.description: Provides harm reduction services, medical and behavioral health care, linkages to housing, and hygiene services for people experiencing homelessness in Los Angeles. Offers comprehensive clinic and outreach services.
resources.eligibility_requirements: People experiencing homelessness in Los Angeles. Open to all who need services.
resources.fees: Free or low-cost services, accepts insurance
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Homeless Healthcare Los Angeles clinic'

resources.name: Northeast Valley Health Corporation (NEVHC)
resources.description: Federally Qualified Health Center serving medically underserved residents of Los Angeles County, particularly in San Fernando and Santa Clarita valleys. Operates 10+ health centers providing medical, dental, and behavioral health services.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Medically underserved residents of Los Angeles County. Serves all regardless of ability to pay. Priority for low-income individuals and families.
resources.fees: Sliding fee scale based on income, accepts Medi-Cal and other insurance
accessibility_features: Appointment hotlines for SFV and SCV
Serves all regardless of ability to pay
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Northeast Valley Health Corporation NEVHC Los Angeles'

resources.name: Youth Mentoring Connection
resources.description: Nonprofit organization empowering at-risk youth by matching them with caring and skilled mentors. Provides mentorship programs and support services in South Los Angeles.
resources.eligibility_requirements: At-risk youth in South Los Angeles. Youth must be referred or apply for mentoring services.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Youth Mentoring Connection Los Angeles'

resources.name: Toberman Neighborhood Center
resources.description: Community-based nonprofit providing comprehensive services including afterschool programs, food pantry, emergency rental assistance, gang intervention, and family support in San Pedro and Harbor Area since 1907.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Families and individuals in San Pedro and Harbor Area. Specific eligibility varies by program.
resources.fees: Free or low-cost services based on program
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Toberman Neighborhood Center San Pedro Los Angeles'

resources.name: Clínica Monseñor Oscar A. Romero
resources.description: Community health center providing comprehensive medical, dental, and behavioral health services to low-income individuals and families. Serves primarily Latino/a communities in Westlake and Boyle Heights with culturally-sensitive care.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Low-income individuals and families of all ages. Serves uninsured and underinsured patients. Sliding fee scale based on income.
resources.fees: Sliding fee scale based on income, accepts Medi-Cal and other insurance
accessibility_features: Evening and Saturday hours at Boyle Heights location
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Clinica Romero Los Angeles healthcare clinic'

notes: Fourth research batch for Los Angeles, CA expansion. Focus on youth services, community health centers, culturally-specific services (API, Latino), mental health, and geographic diversity (San Fernando Valley, San Pedro, East LA). All contact information verified from organization websites and official sources.
